distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for kernel is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Advanced Mission Critical Update Support, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Update Services for SAP Solutions, and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.6 Telecommunications Update Service.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The kernel packages contain the Linux kernel, the core of any Linux operating system.

Security Fix(es):

* kernel: race condition in snd_pcm_hw_free leading to use-after-free (CVE-2022-1048)

* kernel: netfilter: nf_tables: disallow anonymous set with timeout flag (CVE-2024-26642)

* kernel: fs: sysfs: Fix reference leak in sysfs_break_active_protection() (CVE-2024-26993)

Bug Fix(es):

* core: backport rps_default_mask support (JIRA:RHEL-26427)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâs sound subsystem in the way a user triggers concurrent calls of PCM hw_params. The hw_free ioctls or similar race condition happens inside ALSA PCM for other ioctls. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: race condition in snd_pcm_hw_free leading to use-after-free
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Keeping the rating as Moderate, because this issue is hard to trigger and requires some permissions for accessing the sound card and only exists if a specific model of the sound card such as Intel 82801 or similar. The known reproducer works only for systems where the /dev/snd/pcmC0D1c device exists.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

To mitigate this issue, prevent the module snd-pcm from being loaded. Please see https://access.redhat.com/solutions/41278 for information on how to blacklist a kernel module to prevent it from loading automatically.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: race condition in snd_pcm_hw_free leading to use-after-free

cwe.name: Improper Control of Resource Identifiers ('Resource Injection')

notes.text:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

netfilter: nf_tables: disallow anonymous set with timeout flag

Anonymous sets are never used with timeout from userspace, reject this.
Exception to this rule is NFT_SET_EVAL to ensure legacy meters still work.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: netfilter: nf_tables: disallow anonymous set with timeout flag
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: netfilter: nf_tables: disallow anonymous set with timeout flag

notes.text:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

fs: sysfs: Fix reference leak in sysfs_break_active_protection()

The sysfs_break_active_protection() routine has an obvious reference
leak in its error path.  If the call to kernfs_find_and_get() fails then
kn will be NULL, so the companion sysfs_unbreak_active_protection()
routine won't get called (and would only cause an access violation by
trying to dereference kn->parent if it was called).  As a result, the
reference to kobj acquired at the start of the function will never be
released.

Fix the leak by adding an explicit kobject_put() call when kn is NULL.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kernel: fs: sysfs: Fix reference leak in sysfs_break_active_protection()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

The system must be rebooted for this update to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: kernel: fs: sysfs: Fix reference leak in sysfs_break_active_protection()
